alert.note: Alert for Buncombe; Haywood; Madison; Yancey (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 12:44PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT MADISON...NORTHEASTERN HAYWOOD... NORTHWESTERN BUNCOMBE AND NORTHERN YANCEY COUNTIES THROUGH 115 PM EDT... At 1244 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles southeast of Greeneville to 13 miles northwest of Marshall to 16 miles north of Waynesville. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burnsville, Marshall, Mars Hill, Hot Springs, Leicester, Smoky Mountains-Big Creek, Weaverville, Ramseytown, Waterville, and Fines Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
